body:
Typing this in the middle of a fucking pandemic, with the world's democracies backsliding before surging authoritarianisms sabotaging public trust to gain power... this hits different.

Please, if the world must end, end it quickly. End it without these bastards getting what they want. Extinction is literally better than authoritarianism.
Guys please just read the entire series, they ain't that long and they are really great.
I'm still confused on what that "gift of the 2050" from the "Sorako" alliance was toward the end. What was it?!?!
Amazing story
That was a nice story

My first anime girl crush is on a girl with traits like Sorako. Never have I felt so much throbbing in my heart as I did..... I'm so glad I came across this to be able to relive that same feeling I had back when I was a kid.

God this ending scares me, they just gonna discard the entire planet if one child was dropped on the head and became a murderer? 

That’s some fucked up shit right there.
This needs more than just 1K favs
Well fck me then
So if a random lady tries to bed you... do it! and congratz! you have been deemed an interesting investigation to repopulate the future earth.
great shit right here man, the author is fucking amazing
one of the best authors in this site
finally not just some hey wanna fuck story
I actually cried...
God Damn! I cant express my emotion now but holy sh*t it was so good~!

I wish she make doujin more 
This author is legend
That plot tho
God dang, the plot and the art, very good 100/100
Well damn, 100/100, sad tho

@Rendarg ok the think the killed humanity is Yellow stone which is a real thing and is over due 
Yellowstone was suppose to explode years ago so we are lucky it hasn’t 

Yellow stone coverd the earth with ASH that would kill almost all the population in 2 months and it will also cause another ice age

And the author(I think ) is using an acutall scientific theory 
The theory says that there are living organism out there but they won’t show us until we reach a certain level of advancement so I think this is what the girls were taking about in the early chapters about the treaty
Didn't expect to find a story so good like that in a doujin, gladly surprised. Amazing art, by the way.
Ooof, didn't expect this. Guess I'll read the whole serie
where the like button for comment?

"Let them die" should never be the solution. I really don't know how I should feel about this series. It started out amazing, with sweet characters and great art, but the ending feels a tad bit disappointing. It was never even really explained, why they can't interfere. I think in chapter 3 she said something about "they would become the laughing stock of the universe, if they did that.". Okay... I think that's still a better option than letting a whole civilization with billions of people die. It makes the alien's motives seem really odd. Like as if they just pretend to care, but they actually just care about their "intergalactic reputation" and their little life seeding experiment. Also makes this "Greatest single mothers in the universe" panel seem rather odd. How does "Let them die, we can just start all over again and again." fit in with that? Sorry, if I ruined this for anyone. Just felt that "Let's fix this shit together" would have been a much better message than "Let them die"
*Weepinglikealilbitch*
WUT!?? I came here only for fap, not for cry :'uuuuu
Fucking damn
that ending was lame. a wild alien spaceship appeared.
Very nice, but I'm kind of confused. Who was Kanata's message for in the last chapter? Who are the elderly couple in the puzzle flashback? Whose grave are they visiting before the sub leaves Japan?

Came here to fap, but stayed for the story. This series was the best doujinshi series i've ever had the pleasure of reading.
Many thanks ~~
Ohh God, i cried, i really cried with this one.
Holy shit...
Damn, i'm actually crying reading this...
Fk this. It hits nationalism so bad.
Theory of Ancient Civilizations on Earth?

Finally 
Dem , i cried a lot 
As expected of otaku beam , never make me disappoint
Oh cool, this is a series! The story looks interesting so I guess I'll read this from the begining.
